page.title: 14ECOLOGY
page.content: In the last century the area around {St. Day}was known as the{richest {square mile}in the{westen world because of the{copper mines.}However, by the end of the century all the mines were waste and desolate because copper had been discovered in{Africa. The mines were left and the country was covered with mine waste.In 1981 the County Council decided to reclaim it.They thought of farming but the {arsenic}and{copper}in the ground would {poison}the land.It was decided to plan trees for enjoyment.{68,000 trees were planted including:sycamore,alder ash,oak,pine and hawthorn .They planted them about 1.5m apart so they would be well protected from the wind.They employed twenty people on a Manpower service scheme.They fenced the area to prevent{vandalism}from people and{destruction}by rabbits.
